messages.message:
Hi :wave: ,

We’re planning to remove `docker-rmi-dangling` (remove unreferenced images) which is a sub-task for every `push-*` command/Make Target. The reason is - we’re suspecting that when multiple builds are running simultaneously in a build machine then this `docker-rmi-dangling` is removing the intermediate layers of other concurrent jobs (race condition, not 100% sure).

One of the failed pipeline - https://jenkins.instabase.com/job/certify-service/1338/console

Note - This change might affect your local system’s disk size if you frequently run `push-*` command from your local machine.
The reason why we had put this was because otherwise images become too big (and also the build machine runs out of space).
There is already a cronjob installed now on the build machines which clears the stale images on daily basis.

>  otherwise images become too big
I'll look into this part more deeply on why this happens.
